website_summaries.verdict: Wi-Fi connectivity and a new processor help make Canon's PowerShot SX280 HS one of the top compact megazooms available. But you'd better load up on batteries.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX280 HS has shooting modes for every type of photographer from casual to advanced
a useful long zoom lens with excellent image stabilization
and overall excellent photo and video quality for a compact megazoom
cons: Battery life is short, especially if you use the Wi-Fi and GPS features or movie capture
The flash isn't in a great location, and there are no easy panorama or HDR shooting options

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot SX280 HS puts 20x zoom in your pocket, along with Wi-Fi, GPS, and 1080p60 video capture. It's an ideal travel camera, and earns our Editors' Choice award.

customer_reviews.title: The SX280 model has KNOWN Battery related problems
customer_reviews.text: This camera has issues when taking video, the low battery flashes when you try to use the zoom, and the camera will prematurely shut down. Search for this issue on the internet, and read the complaints before spending money on this Cannon camera -- I wish I had. Cannon doesn't have a firmware update to address the issue but they will apparently fix this at no charge, see following product advisory that they sent me AFTER I sent mine in to be repaired. Product Advisories Document:  For me, Cannon service is just lacking in a number of different areas, I will NEVER buy another Cannon product in my life
customer_reviews.author: W. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: best value of the sx cameras!
customer_reviews.text: fantastic little camera and great pics and incredible value! well made and tough case, not a big fan of the pop up flash but nothing is perfect...metering and exposure is very close and i often carry this lil unit instead of my big 500D. Battery life is not great but they are rechargeable and cheap so buy 5 online and take pics for days... Its got wifi and it works, i set up free dropbox account and it automatically syncs with all my devices. Nice! Ill take this one over any of the new models anyday! Its got all the MPixels u will ever use or need...
customer_reviews.author: Bamapartsman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because it sounded like an upgrade from my last Canon. Manual settings harder to accomplish. I thought I'd eventually acclimate but never got easier. Not a pleasure to use. Now the wifi transmission has stopped sending the photos properly. They are as likely to be blurred as clear after transmission even though they are clear on the camera. Was purchased about a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: this is my second SX280. My first one was bought at Costco in 2014. Great camera but it had battery issues. I don't know what firmware means,but it wasn't the problem. The problem wasn't the battery. The battery wasn't making good contact in the camera. I cut a thin piece of cardboard ( I used a aspirin box) and placed it on the battery before I closed the lid. It worked for 3 years before my dog chewed up the camera.I have since bought another SX280 from amazon March 2017. It seems they have fixed the contact problem. I have had no problems with the camera and I have used it extensively.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence downey

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not camera buff, but I do love this camera. It takes great photos and is easy to use. I like using the canon-app to wirelessly transfer the pics to my phone. It has a variety of functions, but I typically take pics in the automatic setting, and for me its sufficient. Like I said, I'm no camera buff. I'm sure there are better cameras on market, but for the features, the pic quality, and price, I'm satisfied. I give it a 4-star because I had to download an upgrade after making the purchase. It was a bit confusing figuring out how to go about doing it at first, but I eventually figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: SunSeekingNomad

customer_reviews.title: Good photo quality, but too many negatives for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The compact body is sturdy and has a great build quality but very poorly designed. The flash pops up where most people intuitively hold the camera and the power button gets pressed by mistake also due to the location. The battery issue however is the most substantial problem with this camera. When the camera is in video mode, especially when the zoom is operated, the battery indicator will show a low battery and power down the camera. Canon has offered a firmware update that made almost no difference. Overall this one is a loser and as usual Canon wasn't even interested in talking about a replacement or exchange. Skip this one, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R

customer_reviews.title: Good overall camera
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it, great all purpose camera with HD video. Pictures and videos look great, zoom is good. Downsides: - the placement of the flash, where you normally hold the camera. - implementation of the wireless features: you have to go through a cumbersome setup to get Facebook etc configured, and at some point Facebook upload stopped working so I had to do this again. - the wireless range is not great (compared to an iPad for example), -if you want to transfer your pictures wirelessly it will take forever, since it first upload them to a Canon server. So you'll still have to use the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Florin

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Camera...
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, don't buy this camera... It's a great camera. Takes good pictures. Video quality is average if it can figure out what to actually focus on. 1 star rating is for the battery problem that makes the camera pretty much unusable. If you had hoped to take video of your kids on this camera, you won't be able to on this camera. If you are lucky enough to shoot a video, it will kill your battery in about 20 seconds. I am amazed that Amazon continues to sell this product when they are fully aware of this MAJOR issue. I actually feel a bit betrayed by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jon T

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Fast, great photos. And I love GPS options. I bought one when they were new and broke it. So I replaced it. But new one is NOT exactly the same! They look the same but there are differences. For example, the old one had a digital zoom, missing on the new one. I used it sometimes to double check details in a frame. A bigger deal? I swear this camera is fussier about lower light. Can't prove that, but sure seems like it. And during my recent Egypt trip, only 7 of my hundreds of photos recorded a GPS location. Not sure why. Need more research. But that lowers my review to a 4.
customer_reviews.author: BC189

customer_reviews.title: Bought This One to Replace Defunct PowerShot 200SX
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this one does not have all the same qualities of my 200SX that got ruined on a cruise ship shore excursion through numerous mud puddles in a crude dune buggy resembling an oversized go-cart. First: The view finder does not utilize full area of glassed screen i.e. Canon improvised using screen also used with other models: this one with right side 10% of screen staying black when viewing pictures taken. Even worse is the absolutely horrendous short life of battery shooting time. In hindsight (had I known) I would have switched to another top brand instead - Nikon or Sony.
customer_reviews.author: GRIN-N-BARRETT

customer_reviews.title: Takes Great Photos and is easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this point and shoot camera, and while I have mostly used the auto setting and the backlight, it just takes great pics. Low light photos turn out perfect. Lots of options and capabilities that I haven't even begun to discover yet. I need a tutorial to start using it to it's full capacity. But even just on Auto, it's wonderful. Battery use has been very adequate..not problems with running out of power. Easy to charge, fits in my pocket or purse. The software is intuitive and easy to use also. I use it for traveling, family events, and sometimes even real estate photos. It's wide angle and my shots come out lovely. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: P. H. Yanoshik

customer_reviews.title: This is a good little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little camera. It takes really nice pictures and is small enough to carry in a purse or on a belt. The problem is that the battery doesn't fit tightly in the camera or in the recharger so the camera will read "charge battery" just after charging. I have to put a folded piece of paper under the tab that holds the battery in the camera and during recharging to keep it tight.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. I got my first one when they came on the market years ago and it went through a ton of abuse. Even though it had been dropped a gillion times, gotten damp, had a lense that wouldn't shut anymore and had dents all over it, it still out performed my other cameras and was still working like a champ. I didn't want to change so I found another even though it is "outdated" on the market. I gave the old one to my dad and have the new one attached to my hip everywhere I go, just as the last one. The zoom is excellent. It is compact and light.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Image Quality, Video Problems
customer_reviews.text: I can't say I wasn't warned. MANY reviews were talking about the low battery warning during video and I've encountered the same problem. I am a professional photographer with a high quality DSLR and am definitely impressed with the image quality of the camera. It delivers far better than I expected from a point and shoot and the zoom range is incredible. But I am sending it in to Canon hoping the video problem can be resolved!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Gayler

customer_reviews.title: I liked the 10x Canon alright but it ate AA batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily in my home inspection business. I liked the 10x Canon alright but it ate AA batteries voraciously. I was going through 4 - 6 AA's a day. This unit lasts a full day to a day and a half and the rechargeable batteries fit into the briefcase easily. The 20x is awesome, the unit compact and lens very good. The flash is a bit of a pain when it pops up while your fingers are in the way but I am learning how to hold it better. Overall, this is the best compact camera I have used in my 15 years of inspections.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big techy, but I love this camera. Cannon's easy user friend set up helps makes taking pictures easy. I mostly put it on Auto and the pictures comes out great. Gave it to my sister for her trip to Paris and her pictures were amazing. Even in 20x zoom, the clarity was great. Haven't used it enough to tell you how it does at night or with rapid shots or in motion, but for a basic point and shoot, this thing is amongst the top. I would highly recommend a back up battery. When taking the HD videos, it does drain the battery relatively quick (no more than usual like my cell phone).
customer_reviews.author: hai quach

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I had before and I continue to love it. I prefer taking pictures with a camera ...
customer_reviews.text: My co-worker dropped my new camera in this exact model. After researching for weeks, it seemed cheaper to replace the camera. This is exactly what I had before and I continue to love it. I prefer taking pictures with a camera than my phone. The picture quality is great for a non-professional who just likes to capture life moments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take a gamble, lose $250
customer_reviews.text: WON'T KEEP A CHARGE. Initially, I thought the battery was to blame, so we bought a new one. Then, when that battery failed to work, I went online for troubleshooting info. Couldn't find anything except similar complaints. Called Canon, got horrible support. In hindsight, I should have packed the stupid thing back into the box immediately and sent it back, but I waited too long trying to solve the problem and now I can't return it because I missed my "window". Out $250. Should have paid more attention to the almost 100 one-star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Girl Writes Words

customer_reviews.title: CANON POWERSHOT SX280
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this camera for a short period but I love it. I have always purchased the Canon PowerShots as they are so easy to use and carry. Recently I also purchased a Canon Rebel SLR, the smaller SLR. This camera is the smallest of the SLR camera and very easy to use but it is not a PowerShot. I just love the Canon SX280. They take great pictures and the zoom is great. I would recommend this camera to those who like to carry a small camera for quick pictures. This one is a little bigger than my previous Canon PowerShot SD950IS. Great camera
customer_reviews.author: SouthOC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Pictures from this Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that could fit in my pocket but take good pictures with a strong zoom. This camera was PERFECT for my recent Alaska trip. I could easily tuck it away when it rained, but pull it out quickly to capture wildlife. The zoom was fantastic for a small camera - even used the camera as binoculars, the zoom was so good. Vacation pictures turned out GREAT! As others have said, the pop-up flash is in a bad location, but I knew that before purchasing and tried to remember to hold the camera so I didn't block the flash.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this version
customer_reviews.text: I liked this camera a lot for the first few months I owned it. The camera took nice, clear, good color pictures. Then after owning it for 5 months, it stopped working. It wouldn't turn on, once when it was on it would not turn off. The battery was fully charged. I returned the camera to Canon and they replaced it with a SX700 HS because it couldn't be fixed. I would recommend skipping to buying the 700 and not bothering with the 280. Canon was great, they replaced my camera very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: VTmom

customer_reviews.title: Started out great but after six months it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Started out great but after six months it stopped working. Sent to Cannon who were very helpful and stood by the product. They said could not be fixed and would send me a refurbished one in return. Still am not to happy. When I power on it does not always work. Seems like cover that connects the battery does not always make good contact with camera therefore not turning on. This was the issue with my first camera. I probably would not replace this one with another cannon.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Super Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Camera is a true 5 Star. However, the soft ware is lacking. Customer service on the software was not helpful. The SX280HS is a super camera. I think it takes better photos than the 260. The zoom is impressive for a pocket camera. WiFi works as advertised. GPS can add to slide shows and of course is great for folks like Realtors, Engineers ... This camera reminds me of the advice "The Best Camera you own is the one you have with you". I have already written a review and recommendation for a friend to purchase the 280.
customer_reviews.author: Intruder

customer_reviews.title: I loved the features of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I loved the features of this camera, especially the built-in GPS and the fast burst-shot mode. Unfortunately there was a notice from Canon that there can be problems with the battery life. I sometimes found that to be true when making videos. I would have liked a larger aperture setting for depth of field effects but I understand that it is a limitation of a compact camera. After thousands of photos and some short videos I returned it to Canon under their recall advisory and received an SX700 HS. I still miss the SX280, however.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mairs

customer_reviews.title: The first week I did not like it at all
customer_reviews.text: The first week I did not like it at all.....but once I really started using it during a trip, I just love it. Great pictures with the telephoto as well as macro. I love how easy is to make videos and the quality of the images ....I am still learning the many features the camera offers.....like wifi and gps. As some other reviewers had said....the batteries can be drained very quickly if you do videos. I recommend the camera to my friend. The price is right too....at least when I bought it for less than 200$.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M. Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera, I have always bought and used Sony ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Camera, I have always bought and used Sony Digital Cameras and wanted to give another brand a try??? I found the reviews here on Amazon to be very confusing when buying??? Maybe a bit to in depth for the avg buyer? But after...just doing it...buying it...I love it! Does everything and ever more then a none professional but full time picture taker could want. Very pleased and thought it was a fair priced camera.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera it takes GREAT pictures for being a small camera! You cannot beat the price for the quality of the product! I dropped my 1st one and the screen got a big crack in the middle of it. It would great still and took great pictures. My son then knocked it over and fell in water so that is the main reason I had to get this one. But I replaced it the next day by buying this one because it is so worth buying and having if you don't want the big heavy Canon. I would really recommend this to anyone who loves taking pictures and wants good quality photography.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Cautious
customer_reviews.text: I am contemplating buying this camera for the 3rd time. I loved my first one! I carry a camera at all times and this one is easy to use and takes quality pictures. The zoom is excellent. After about 3 years the button to turn on the camera quit working. I decided instead of paying $125-$150 to have it fixed I would just purchase a new one. Again I loved the camera but within the month of purchase, the ön" button broke again so I returned it. Just can't decide if I want to risk it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera used from Amazon. Came with a after-market battery and charger. Considering the price of the camera it functions as expected. We were going on a cruise and I didn't want to rely on our cell phones. Received the camera as advertised and as promised.
customer_reviews.author: taf45377

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Okay... so I may not know how to fully take advantage of the awesomeness that this baby packs but I love it. The zoom is sick and the image quality is quite satisfying. Kinda awkward to have the power button and the shutter side by side, but other than that I really like this camera. Oh! the wifi capability is a super plus. I have the android app that communicates with the camera and I can review the pictures on my phone and share too. BTW.. I bought this one to replace another Canon PowerShot that got stolen which replaced an older model. You can say I have a thing for Canon.
customer_reviews.author: StormyD

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: Purchased knowing about the power problems. As feared, mine had the problems too despite the new firmware. Sent camera to Canon for repair. Issue is now slightly less pronounced, but the battery simply doesn't supply enough power to run multiple power-hungry settings at the same time. GPS and full HD video are the worst culprits. Would have been an incredible camera had Canon not undershot the power capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ewert

customer_reviews.title: ... 35 millimeter camera and thought it couldn't get any better. Well
customer_reviews.text: Long ago I purchased a 35 millimeter camera and thought it couldn't get any better. Well, it has. Since their beginning Digital cameras have come a long way and the Canon PowerShot SX280 12.1MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Image is proof. I don't think, for the money, picture quality and functionality this camera can be beat. It's compact and can fit in your shirt pocket so you don't need a large clumsy camera bag to hoss it around. :-)
customer_reviews.author: jmalti001

customer_reviews.title: This camera takes wonderful picture and it is very user friendly for people ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes wonderful picture and it is very user friendly for people (like myself) who aren't tech savvy. Also, the zoom on this camera was incredible! However a major flaw with this camera was that the video function basically does not work. When you try to take a video it says that the battery is dieing, and then after a few seconds it dies... However, the battery is not actually dead because you can turn it back on to picture mode on the camera will have full battery life again!! It does not matter charged the battery is.. The camera will not take videos longer than a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: I do not believe it was ever used
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with the camera it’s just like new. I’ve got a lot to learn but it’s a very nice camera
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Died After 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased here at amazon.com. The camera was great, but DIED after 4 months. Suddenly it turned off with the lens open and did not turn on again. Have to send for repair to Canon, and obviously it is a pain to ship it, fill forms, bla bla bla.... also, the camera gives battery problems, even if you upgrade the firmware, if you shoot video it will display a battery problem and turn off. AVOID this camera. I am a CANON fan, but this model is TO AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I bought it for its compact-ness and the high level of zoom which is 20x optical. Sometimes my fingers would hit the wrong button when turning the dial or choosing a setting and I have small female hands/fingers. That could be a problem. Never used the video. The stabilization feature was good because most shots were from a moving canoe.
customer_reviews.author: LYNN MARIE

customer_reviews.title: Love the zoom range on this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the zoom range on this camera! I've taken some really nice pictures at some concerts with it that make it seem I was right in front of the stage. Only concern is the battery life. If you use the zoom at lot (or the viedo), the battery drains fast. I just make sure I always have a spare with me. This camera has all the usual settings and is easy to use. The ability to wifi connect is a nice feature allowing you to easily post to social media.
customer_reviews.author: paobs6

customer_reviews.title: good camera, takes good quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: good camera, takes good quality pictures, is nice looking and a good size. The only drawback is right handers will have a tendency to hold it so the flash is covered, there is no real handgrip so I have caught myself blocking the flash from popping up many times now, you have to be aware of where your fingers are.
customer_reviews.author: Tye

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but would not shut off.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, but to have someone ship a defective unit wastes my time and is very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Finally no blurry pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this camera once so far, but I'm pleased with the pictures. My biggest concern was not having blurry pictures. Lo and behold none of them are blurry! And I LOVE the zoom! It zooms so far, I could spy on my neighbors if I wanted to! My only complaint with this camera is the size. It's a little too big for my old camera case that held the Nikon cool pix and another compact camera. And besides that, it's very heavy. Oh well I still love it and will deal with the size to not have blurry pictures!
customer_reviews.author: TinaRN

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a cheap small camera to carry in her purse, she wanted to take pic on her way to work. I checked all the reviews at amazon and other review sites and finally decided on this camera. My wife has loved it. She has taken over 500 pictures in a short period and they all are fantastically clear. The pictures are as clear as some of the more expensive ones. If you get one you will be well satisfied
customer_reviews.author: MAV

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other reviewers, the camera will not take movies. As soon as you stet, it displays low battery and turns off. Trying power button 2 times will turn it back on, and camera displays full charge. You can take pictures, but as soon as you try video it turns off. At times the mode selected for pictures gets "confused" and portrait begins to take sports pictures, etc. Returning it today
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: The camera is great, except for the fact that every review about ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great, except for the fact that every review about the battery here is true. My camera is supposed to be the updated firmware version, but after shooting 2 minutes of video with this camera, the battery died on me. Sure, I was zooming while filming, but the camera should stay on for more than two minutes right? Really terrible work on this one Canon. If you're at all interested in shooting video with a point and shoot, this is NOT the camera for you. Otherwise, all the other features are great. If the battery was not an issue, I would definitely give more stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander W. Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacation camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last minute pre-trip to south africa with no time to read instructions Got great closeups of every major animal group. Only issue was low light conditions. Otherwise the images were stabilized well despite the shakiness of the jeep i traveled in and the focus control was very good. Used the Canon Mirror software to send all images to my ipad every evening- like magic!
customer_reviews.author: Witz

customer_reviews.title: I had a previous model of this camera and LOVED IT.
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous model of this camera and LOVED IT... HOWEVER I would not buy this again... The battery drains very fast and sometimes the camera thinks it's dead and sometimes it doesn't... Also images at higher zoom are just not as good of quality and much more susceptible to blur than my older version of this camera.... Overall I'm dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great camera value.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is a great size and has needed features. Battery life is not as great as desired but is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dault

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX280: Great Choice for Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot SX280 is 12 MP digital camera that is small enough to fit in your pocket or handbag. But don't let the small size fool you.The 12.1 megapixel camera features a 1/2.3-inch CMOS sensor and Canon DIGIC 6 image processor for great low-light performance and sharp image quality. Plus, it has a really powerful 20x optical zoom and on-board Optical Image Stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Taking video with zoom turns camera off!!
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this camera - It's pretty, compact, great features, good quality photos - but when taking video (with zoom) the camera will shut down automatically. This is a deal breaker for me! I even got the latest firmware and experimented with it on several occasions... I tried taking video at a concert with the battery fully charged and had bad luck. It will take the video for about a minute or so, but then once I zoomed in it just shut down. I tried again, then 30 seconds it shut down. If you don't use video, it's a great camera. However, if you plan to use the video feature please don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON BREAUX

customer_reviews.title: Battery ssues the ultimate deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this camera - pictures were crisp & clear, but the ultimate deal-breaker was the battery issue that others have mentioned. Last straw was taking a video with what started as a full battery charge (fresh off the charger). Literally, in under 2 minutes, the battery was drained and the indicator was flashing that the battery was almost dead. Come on, Canon, fix this!
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX280
customer_reviews.text: I needed something small, yet takes good pics. Canon came through on this one. I updated the Firmware without any issues. I have the 1700 batteries and they last longer. I put in a 64GB SDHC Card and it works great. No problems to date.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Utter

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAMERA ON THE MARKET!  Does everything you want and more!
customer_reviews.text: Best Camera I have ever owned! Coupled with the ability to transfer the photos directly via WIFI, (even while still out sightseeing!) to my girlfriends camera, to either of our Smart Phones or to my laptop or tablet at the hotel at night.... PRICELESS! I have now purchased 4 of these! One for me and 3 for gifts. Everyone loves them!
customer_reviews.author: C. Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is lousy
customer_reviews.text: But the camera itself is quite satisfactory. I have an older version of this, and the video on the SX280 is noticeably better. Nice zoom for a compact body, but it really isn't usable beyond 20x, at least without a tripod, so beware. I got it with the Square Trade warranty just in case since the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Cook

customer_reviews.title: I love the color rendition
customer_reviews.text: Here's my story. I've owned this camera for about 4 years and shot well over 15,000 pictures with it, mainly doing real estate photography. I love the color rendition, low light quality, instant zoom, one-hand operation and durability (dropped it too many times to remember). The last time I dropped it - the display stopped working. So I thought I'd buy a newer Samsung WB350F - terrible. Then I bought an Olympus PEN camera - also terrible. So I decided to order another PowerShot SX280. Can't argue with success.
customer_reviews.author: mason w.

customer_reviews.title: Canon keeps selling defective cameras
customer_reviews.text: I was deceived. The camera is defective: when you use the video, the battery indicator blinks and suddenly the camera stops, a problem that has been repetitively mentioned in different forums. According to a Canon's advisory (January 2015), the affected cameras can be identified by their serial numbers. But I received a camera within those serial numbers and it IS DEFECTIVE. Besides that, the camera seems to work fine. Because of that, as I think that I will not be using the camera for video, I think I will keep it. But I'm not happy...
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Masaya

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because my son has the same one and he recommended it to me as easy to use. I have not taken photos for quite some time and wanted something I could ease into. I do like this camera and have no issues with it so far. It takes really good photos, is easy to use and honestly, I'm still learning. I can recommend it for anyone who wants a small and convenient camera to take good photos the easy way.
customer_reviews.author: History loving Granny

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this camera for 6 months and we love it. We haven’t had any of the battery issues mentioned by other reviewers. Indeed, we purchased extra batteries because of what other reviewers posted, but we haven’t needed to use them. Having three grandchildren, we have taken many movies with the camera along with many photos. Compared to the Canon Elph cameras we have had in the past, the picture quality is amazing with this camera. We have also been impressed with the photos taken in poorly lit rooms; overall, we are delighted with the camera and we have recommended it to our friends and relatives.
customer_reviews.author: cch

customer_reviews.title: I have to say it was a big mistake and waste of money to purchase this model
customer_reviews.text: It was a very disappointing experience. Within 6 months of purchase, the camera frequently shut down by itself, especially when I was about to shoot pictures at critical moments. On the screen it says "Error 32". I looked up the internet and found many other users having eth same problem. The lens shutter is problematic, too. Many of the picture I took has shadows on the left top corner. I have to say it was a big mistake and waste of money to purchase this model. I previously had a SX260 and had no such problem/.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love Cannon
customer_reviews.text: PowerShot gets better and better. What I like about this one is the 20X optical zoom. I've used it to get photos of birds that are much better than the 10X I had before. The photo quality is better than a larger, more expensive camera I use. This one is a little heavier than other travel cameras I've had but so far it has been worth it
customer_reviews.author: Sid Frost

customer_reviews.title: it's just ok
customer_reviews.text: Not very impressed with this camera. It still has the battery issue that I read about in the reviews before buying it. Plus a lot of the pictures we have taken have been blurry, especially with any movement. Consumer reports rated this camera pretty high but I am not so sure about this one.
customer_reviews.author: UT Vols Fan

customer_reviews.title: Love my CANON!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying CANON cameras as far as I can remember. I wanted to update as my last one had a much smaller screen. This one is just simply great. The zoom is awesome and everything is just like me old one but with more added features. I haven't tried out all the features as yet, but so far so good and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky99

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived in good time and was well packaged. We have used it, however, not to any great extent yet. The pictures we have taken are vibrant and bright. The zoom feature is excellent. Have used the video feature only to see if it actually functions, and it does. We will be taking this camera on a trip abroad soon, so hoping it's as good as it appears to be. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Clasen

customer_reviews.title: pretty annoying because it has some cool shooting options and ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery problem when shooting video, pretty annoying because it has some cool shooting options and slow motion setting. For pictures it is great and had once of the best zooms for its size. I used it while on a two and a half week hiking trip and for the pictures, it was great
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Fantactic Camera - does as much or more than the much larger Power Shot cameras.
customer_reviews.text: Does as advertised. A couple years ago I bought a Canon Power Shot S2 IS. It is larger and heaver and does not come close to the functionality of the SX280. I love the HD pictures, et al. The SX280 is easy to use and fits in your top pocket. The 20x optical zoom is fantastic, especially for such a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking, don't be such a tight wad.
customer_reviews.text: I was too cheap to get a good camera so this is my fault. It really runs the battery down fast. I ended up buying 2 spare batteries and am always charging one in the truck when traveling. Also it is easy to turn it off when trying to take a photo. I've missed a lot of good shots due to my clumsy, big finger.
customer_reviews.author: Hjul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I am not a photographer by any means, so take this with a grain of salt. I use the camera primarily while out hiking or at social gatherings and so far it has taken nice crisp photos. For a photo dummy like me the auto function works great for point and click shooting. Performs much better than the Nikon Coolpix I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel McClure

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, pics at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, pics at a reasonable price! Clear pics from a distance. Even gets clear sports events/action shots! Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: hola

customer_reviews.title: 2015 New York Mets Spring Training Photos
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the best! If anyone is unsure if this Canon PowerShot SX280 camera is good to bring to any sporting events, I would say ABSOLUTELY, I totally recommend it! I love it and it makes the best picture quality ever. The video quality is just as good. But if you're video taping anything that would take about few minutes or so, make sure you have few battery pack with you because it could run out pretty quickly. Other than that, it's really awesome and a must have kind of camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Yes you can get monster zoom from a small package.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Canons, Nikon, Panasonic and other cameras. I always gravitate back to Canon for point and shoots. This little fella is awesome. It fits in my pocket but has a monster zoom and the photos are phenom! Oh and it wirelessly transmits your photos to FB, computer, phone, etc. Great great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra batteries!
customer_reviews.text: The camera performs very well in all but one critical area. It EATS batteries! I recommend getting backup batteries. Also you can get a more powerful battery than the one that Canon sells. Check out the Vivitar 1700 mAh NB-6LH replacements. Much more bang for your buck. Otherwise camera itself is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased extra batteries (with slightly higher AMPs that the one coming with the camera). I have had no problems with battery life as many report, BUT I do not take many movies with it either. Photo quality is excellent. I use it mainly with existing light and it seems to do a very nice job.
customer_reviews.author: JBJ

customer_reviews.title: I just really really liked my older point and shoot much better
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's ok. I just really really liked my older point and shoot much better. That said, the lens shutter sticks often. Pictures not as clear and vivid as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Provost

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Would've gotten 5 stars if the power button wasn't directly next to the shutter button. I've missed so many once in a lifetime pictures because of this.. Its zoom is still flabbergasting. Bought an extra battery for it. Both the extra and the original won't even charge anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Flash is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera - but not the pop-up flash. What a pain. The camera takes great shots and the zoom is the best I have ever had on a pocket size camera. Night flash shots take some work to get right, but having to reset the flash every time it pops up gets old. Real old...
customer_reviews.author: lostintexas

customer_reviews.title: Major problem: power button where shutter release should be.
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically poor design. I frequently turned the camera off when trying to push the shutter release. Very frustrating, especially when you want to take a "quick grab" photo. Hard to grip. Flash pops up where I would normally put my left index finger.
customer_reviews.author: RheumDoc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: I have several Canon PowerShot cameras. This is by far the best camera I have ever owned. There has been no problem with the battery life, even when shooting video The only thing I don't like about it is the location of the power button
customer_reviews.author: zaj

customer_reviews.title: Good camera with one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: This flaw is that you can hear the zoom while shooting videos. I don't know why Canon manages to keep the zoom silent on their cheaper models, but not on this one. I returned the camera for this reason. Otherwise, the pictures were good, but not as outstanding as others have claimed here.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This camera had trouble with focusing. It was on the highest pixels and still was putting out a small, poor quality pictures. I usually love cannon but not this camera. It may have been a defective one. The reviews were all so great....I was hoping I would feel the same way. : (
customer_reviews.author: Michelle E

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it for the video.
customer_reviews.text: Same issue as stated in other reviews but I thought it had to be corrected already......wrong. when you switch to video mode the battery drains like a sink. The cannon battery lasts longer than the aftermarket brand I bought elsewhere but it still drains fast. The zoom works great and really brings the action up close. For the price it is a good camera but not for video.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Very bad battery life
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this PowerShot, I ignored comments about short battery life (i mean really short like 5 minutes). But I'm telling you, you shouldn't. This is killing my entire enjoyment with this product!
customer_reviews.author: AMK

customer_reviews.title: Love my Cannon!
customer_reviews.text: I love Cannon cameras! I have been a faithful fan since my college days and Cannon does not disappoint with the Powershot SX280. It is easy to use and the picture quality is excellent. In addition, you are able to have HD videos with this camera. It is great for moms who want a little bit of both (picture and video). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: E. Calero

customer_reviews.title: Battery Time
customer_reviews.text: This camera will only record for approximately 12 to 18 minutes. I have downloaded the firm ware and it did not improve the recording time. It does take OK photos. This is just an ordinary camera. Mediocre at best. So If you want a nice camera phone with more bang. Look elsewhere.....
customer_reviews.author: lofon

customer_reviews.title: SO-SO
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes decent pictures in good light and not too bad in lower light if nothing is moving. My complaint is that low light results in a very slow shutter speed and/or a high ISO setting so anything moving (like children) is blurred or grainy. Not nearly as impressed as I would like to be.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: I'd say it's very powerfull, but not the battery...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, great zoon! The only problem I've faced is the battery doesn't stand for too long...I've already bought two new batteries in order to have a better use of it. I'd recommend the camera, but be aware that an extra $24,00 is needed to buy some extra batteries (not a bad deal after all)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B Chimelli

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good, but the design of the camera is bad. The on/off button and the button to take your picture are side by side, I have missed many photos because I set up the shot and hit the off button by mistake. When using the flash, I find that the pop up hits my fingers and disturbs my shot. It is awkward to hold the camera when the flash is in operation.. I have had many Canon camera, including my main camera the 60D, but this camera is awkward, I still haven't found a good way to hold it while taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Reed

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this camera!!! The camera "Charge Battery" indicator will come on even when a fully charged battery is placed into the camera. I am lucky if I can take one picture. This camera is completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: KRR

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Good all-around camera for casual quality point-and-shoot. I took it with me on the road trip, I am very happy with my pictures. Zoom is great. Wi-Fi features work OK, I still find it easier just to plug-in actual memory card into my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas in 2013. Bought an extra battery as well. Battery life is poor. Seems like you charge the battery and go to take pictures and the battery is dead. Have been reading other reviews about the same issue. Finally went out this week and bought another due to this one always leaving us to not be able to take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Burge

customer_reviews.title: Love my new camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my new camera. Outdoor pictures are perfect. Indoor are somewhat off on auto. When I have time will try to correct the error with the white balance. You have to watch how you hold it, get your fingers in the shot.

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera does what is expected and produces quality pictures. This camera worked well for me until I went on the dune buggys in the Dominican Republic. The camera does not resist mud, water, or sand.

customer_reviews.title: Take good pictures though
customer_reviews.text: Record videos is a problems as stated by other reviewers. Canon should have stop selling this defective camera. Take good pictures though.

customer_reviews.title: so good. The auto popup flash is a bit annoying ...
customer_reviews.text: Used extensively over the weekend. So far, so good. The auto popup flash is a bit annoying if your finger happens to be over it when it tries to pop up. It wants you to power cycle the camera to recover if this happens.

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy too use and takes great pictures. I'm very much an amateur but was able to get some great shots on my recent trip to Alaska.

customer_reviews.title: Big mistake from Canon
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a good while ago. As many others, expected to have a firmware fix for the video issue, but it is still dies after 30 seconds or less from when I start video and I have to reset it completely to get back to taking pictures. This product should be recalled.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie U

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Good photos indoors and outdoors. Very nice screen and is easy to use. Flash does come in the way when you hold the camera and creates some risk with dropping the camera when it pops up under your finger. It takes good photos taking into consideration the small size.

customer_reviews.title: fun for great pictures without being an expert
customer_reviews.text: great camera. I'm still not a photog expert but have learned a good deal about light and speed as I've learned to use this camera. Great photos. Better outside than inside but with flash and manual settings can make inside pop too.

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX280
customer_reviews.text: Camera took great pictures on our recent vacation. A lot of people commented on how good the pictures were & wanted to know what kind of camera we had. The only drawback was that your fingers were in the way of the flasher poping up, which was a minor thing that you have to get used to. Other than that, we love the compact size of it.

customer_reviews.title: Great for taking pictures, not so reliable shooting videos
customer_reviews.text: Takes good quality pictures, zoom is awesome, very easy to carry around. My only complaint is that when recording videos the low battery/change battery indicator comes on almost immediately even when you just put in a freshly charged battery.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these cameras and always have one with me. Battery is pretty small and so you do have to be careful to keep it charged. I wish it had AEB, but if it is there, I sure couldn't find it. Make sure you get a spare battery.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: This very small camera has a 20 X zoom going from 25 to 500 35mm equivalent. This makes it the ideal camera to carry where ever you do not want a larger one or an outfit. Be careful not to block the flash but if you do all you have to do is turn the camera off and on again.

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX280 12.1MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD (Black) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black 

SUPER-CHARGED, READY TO SHARE
The PowerShot SX280 HS is a super-charged SX-series model featuring Canon's very latest proprietary processor, the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, for improved performance and exceptional clarity in low-light scenarios. The camera makes it easy to show off your high quality images and video wherever you are, with enhanced built-in Wi-Fi® technology that lets you share photos with comments on social networking sites – even within specific groups. Capture everything from quick snaps to artistic images with a powerful 20x Optical Zoom and 25mm Wide-Angle lens, with Optical Image Stabilizer to reduce blur throughout the zoom range. Even low-light images impress with the Canon HS SYSTEM: a combination of a 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor and the new DIGIC 6 Image Processor. Preserve memories in ultra-smooth 1080p/60p Full HD video with the amazing processing power of the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, which also enables enhanced Dynamic IS for reduced blur, plus video recording in the easy-to-share MP4 format. The camera also gives you access to extraordinary imaging capabilities with Smart AUTO that recognizes 58 predefined scenes, Face ID that adjusts focus and exposure for your loved ones, and Intelligent IS that dramatically reduces camera shake. New Hybrid Auto creates an optimized “highlight reel” of your day, while built-in GPS## records the location and local time, making the PowerShot SX280 HS a perfect travel camera, ready to share the spectacular images you'll capture!

##In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore, be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated.

SHARE SIMPLY FROM WHEREVER YOU ARE
BUILT-IN WI-FI® TECHNOLOGY ALLOWS YOU TO WIRELESSLY TRANSFER YOUR IMAGES TO SOCIAL NETWORKING SITES THROUGH CANON IMAGE GATEWAY#; TO A PC OR UPLOAD VIRTUALLY ANYWHERE ON YOUR IOS® OR ANDROID™ DEVICE* WITH THE FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE CANON CAMERAWINDOW APP**
The PowerShot SX280 HS is equipped with enhanced built-in Wi-Fi® technology for on-the-go convenience when you want to share what you've recorded with friends, family and the whole world. The camera can connect directly to both iOS® and Android™ devices*, and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app** without a computer. Easily post your images to your favorite social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# or save them to the online photo album to share anytime, anywhere. The camera's built-in Wi-Fi® technology also lets you transfer images and video directly to your computer to update friends and family while you're traveling or out and about. Enhanced Wi-Fi® technology makes posting in real time possible, so you can keep everyone up to date with photos even as events unfold. Easily control the destination of your uploads to social networking sites; share with everyone, or send photos to selected groups. Post to groups, add comments, and edit and upload MOV video files from both iOS® and Android™ devices*. Frequently used devices and accounts are stored in the camera's Wi-Fi® history menu, so you can immediately connect with a simple touch. Share with other Wi-Fi® equipped PowerShot cameras, send images to your computer, and print your photos to Wi-Fi® compatible printers^. Built-in Wi-Fi® technology on the PowerShot SX280 HS makes it easier than ever for you to express your creative flair, and share it with the entire world!

# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

* Compatible with iOS version 5.1/6.0/6.1 or later and Android devices version 2.3/4.0/4.1 or later. Data charges may apply.

** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

^ Wireless PictBridge certified printer is required.

CAPTURE THE WORLD AS YOU SEE IT
POWERFUL 20X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 25MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS
The PowerShot SX280 HS features a powerful 20x Optical Zoom Lens that delivers outstanding optical performance and versatility. It does not have rear facing
picture capability.The camera's lens embodies the quality and legacy of Genuine Canon Optics with advantages that go far beyond making the camera slim enough to slip in your pocket and carry anywhere. With a range of 25–500mm (35mm equivalent), the lens gives you the power to capture the full breadth of scenes, with details you've never captured before. Images are bright and vivid with spectacular clarity thanks to Optical Image Stabilization.

OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND FAST PERFORMANCE START HERE
12.1 MEGAPIXEL HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot SX280 HS employs a Canon 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor, which delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.

CANON DIGIC 6 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot SX280 HS is equipped with Canon's very latest proprietary processor, the DIGIC 6 Image Processor. The DIGIC 6 Image Processor makes several important advancements, including improved sensitivity that allows for higher resolution with less noise when shooting in dark conditions. Dynamic IS now detects and compensates for tilt and parallel movement (shift blur) to create video that's exceptionally free of distortion. In addition, the DIGIC 6 Image Processor enables video recording in MP4 format. Highly compressed MP4 video not only preserves space on your memory card but also improves playback on mobile devices.

CANON HS SYSTEM FOR EXCEPTIONAL LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE UP TO ISO 6400
The PowerShot SX280 HS gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with Canon's latest-generation DIGIC 6 Image Processor to create the renowned Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 6400; beautiful low-light shots are possible with maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos and videos.

FULL HD VIDEO THAT'S BETTER THAN EVER
1080P/60P FULL HD VIDEO
With the camera's advanced DIGIC 6 Image Processor enabling MP4 format recording, the PowerShot SX280 HS lets you shoot video at a selectable frame rate of 60 fps or 30 fps. 1080p/60p Full HD video is extraordinarily smooth and rich in playback, ensuring that your important memories and creative film clips look their absolute best. Video recorded at 30 fps has also been improved through the combination of the DIGIC 6 Image Processor and Fine Movie Detail Processing, with reduced noise and high resolution.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS AND VIDEOS
SMART AUTO
Smart AUTO for the PowerShot SX280 HS has been significantly expanded, making it easier than ever to capture the sharp, bright, colorful images – and videos – you're looking for. By assessing various factors in both the background and the subject, the system recognizes 58 predefined shooting situations and automatically selects the camera settings that will yield the best possible results. Simply frame the shot you want, and in dozens of common or challenging scenarios the camera takes care of the rest. Hard-to-capture shots such as moving subjects, night scenes, backlit subjects, and landscapes at evening or on a bright snowy day are instantly and effortlessly captured as "keeper" shots. Smart AUTO makes the PowerShot SX280 HS ideal for capturing excellent quality still images and video on the go.

FACE ID
Face ID on the PowerShot SX280 HS gives you an easy way to improve every shot of the people you love. Simply take a picture of up to 12 faces you would like the camera to register, then enter names and ages. Once a person is registered, the camera will pick him or her out of a group (even against a busy background) and adjust focus and exposure to his or her face, even recognizing faces in profile. Face ID is particularly great for shots of babies and children. The system can pick your baby out of a group of children, focus on your baby when pictured with an adult, and capture the best smile by taking three successive images when the smile is detected. The flash is even disabled so as not to startle the baby and interrupt the moment. Older children in motion are tracked, with focus and exposure continually adjusted with Servo AF; with one shutter press three successive images are captured so the best shot is never missed. And because you'll identify each face you register, Face ID makes it easy to search images by name.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed, and the camera automatically selects the appropriate aperture. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Movie Digest & Hybrid Auto Automatically selects shooting settings for optimal quality and records a video clip every time you capture a still image. One day's worth of clips are then combined into a single video. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Sports The camera uses high shutter speeds to capture fast-moving subjects. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full resolution, providing continuous shooting when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that's perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Discreet Mode Disables flash, AF assist beam, and all camera sounds with one mode dial setting – so you can capture images in quiet areas. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. Actual results may vary from examples shown above.
Final image may vary depending on picture composition.

REMEMBER THE DAY IN CRISP HD
NEW HYBRID AUTO UTILIZES A COMBINATION OF SMART AUTO AND INTELLIGENT IS TO CREATE A BEAUTIFUL AND STEADY 720P HD VIDEO CLIP IN MOVIE DIGEST MODE EVERY TIME YOU SHOOT A STILL IMAGE
New Hybrid Auto on the PowerShot SX280 HS brings enhanced image quality to the popular Movie Digest feature on PowerShot digital cameras. Movie Digest records up to four seconds of video every time you shoot a still image, then automatically joins the clips into a video that captures the essence of special days: vacations, important occasions, any time you're shooting many shots in a day. With Hybrid Auto, this "highlight reel" is more beautiful than ever. Hybrid Auto automatically recognizes the scene and optimizes camera settings to capture the highest possible image quality. The resulting 720p HD video is properly exposed, crisp and steady.

OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot SX280 HS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. THE IDEAL TRAVELING COMPANION
GPS TECHNOLOGY
The PowerShot SX280 HS digital camera is equipped with Global Positioning System (GPS)## technology. Now you can travel the world and let the camera automatically record the location and local time of your stills and videos. The camera can also use the GPS unit to automatically set the exact time. You can maximize the usefulness of the GPS feature by using the special bundled Map Utility software that makes it fun to share the memories of your world adventures. In addition to displaying all your photos' locations on a world map, the camera's GPS system can also track your route from photo to photo – a great way to visualize each trip! You can also create and share custom maps and personal mini-travel guides with friends and family members.

## In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore, be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated.

ECO MODE

ECO Mode can be activated for easy power preservation when an outlet is unavailable or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed. With ECO Mode activated to conserve power, you can even stay connected for longer with the built-in Wi-Fi® feature on the PowerShot SX280 HS. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the night, you can be assured your camera can keep up.
